intro: Rhodanthe margarethae, commonly known as the Margaret's rhytidophyta, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and minimal water.
